alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Pike (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 6:22PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Pike and southwestern Barbour Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 622 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Troy University to near Doster. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Troy, Brundidge, Clio, Louisville, Banks, Blue Springs, Tyler Crossroads, Doster, Antioch, Blue Springs State Park, Hamilton Crossroads, Monticello, Brundidge Municipal Airport and Tennille. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
